qas.question: For which industry were elevators first used?
In the mid 1800s what were elevators fueled by?
What were elevators originally built for?

answers.text: moving goods in bulk in mines and factories

qas.question: The "ascending room" gave customers a view of what city's downtown?

context: Starting in the <a0_0>coal mines<a0_0/>, by the mid-19th century elevators were operated with <a1_0>steam power<a1_0/> and were used for <a2_0>moving goods in bulk in mines and factories<a2_0/>. These steam driven devices were soon being applied to a diverse set of purposes - in 1823, two architects working in London, <a3_0>Burton and Hormer<a3_0/>, built and operated a novel tourist attraction, which they called the "ascending room". It elevated paying customers to a considerable height in the center of <a4_0>London<a4_0/>, allowing them a magnificent panoramic view of downtown.
